medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and nausea for 6 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports intermittent abdominal pain located in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) that has been present for 6 days. The pain is not necessarily associated with food. She has experienced nausea but has not had any vomiting. During this symptomatic period, she has noticed darker urine, but there has been no change in the color of her bowel movements. The patient states she has had this pain episodically in the past but never to this degree.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gallstones since her last pregnancy many years ago; Hypothyroidism; Hypertension; Past surgical history includes umbilical hernia repair twice (laparoscopic then open).
